data.title: Romuald Figuier
authors: Contributors to Eurovision Song Contest Wiki
data.meta_description: Romuald Figuier, also known by his first name, is a French singer who started his career in the early 1960s. To date, he has released several studio albums and singles. He was first selected to represent Monaco in the Eurovision Song Contest 1964 in Copenhagen with the song "Où sont-elles...
data.text:
Romuald Figuier, also known by his first name, is a French singer who started his career in the early 1960s. To date, he has released several studio albums and singles.

He was first selected to represent Monaco in the Eurovision Song Contest 1964 in Copenhagen with the song "Où sont-elles passées", which finished in 3rd place with 15 points.

His second appearance came just five years later in Madrid when he was selected to represent Luxembourg in Madrid with the song "Catherine", which finished in 11th place with 7 points, just a single point behind the entries from Sweden and Germany.

He made his final appearance for Monaco five years later in Brighton with the song "Celui qui reste et celui qui s'en va", which finished in joint 4th place alongside the entries from host nation United Kingdom and Luxembourg.

Aside from his multiple Contest appearances, he represented his home country with the song "Laisse-moi le temps" in the XIV International Song Festival in Viña del Mar, Chile, where he finished as runner up and got the prize for the Best Singer.

Eurovision Song Contest 1964

Songs "Non ho l'età" • "I Love the Little Things" • "Où sont-elles passées" • "Dès que le printemps revient" • "Le chant de Mallory" • "Warum nur, warum?" • "Laiskotellen" • "Spiral" • "Sangen om dig" • "Jij bent mijn leven" • "Près de ma rivière" • "Caracola" • "Man gewöhnt sich so schnell an das Schöne" • "Oração" • "Život je sklopio krug" • "I miei pensieri"

Performers Gigliola Cinquetti • Matt Monro • Romuald • Hugues Aufray • Rachel • Udo Jürgens • Lasse Mårtenson • Arne Bendiksen • Bjørn Tidmand • Anneke Grönloh • Robert Cogoi • Los TNT • Nora Nova • António Calvário • Sabahudin Kurt • Anita Traversi

Eurovision Song Contest 1969

Songs "Vivo cantando" • "Boom Bang-a-Bang" • "De troubadour" • "Un jour, un enfant" • "Bonjour, bonjour" • "Maman" • "The Wages of Love" • "Jennifer Jennings" • "Judy, min vän" • "Primaballerina" • "Catherine" • "Kuin silloin ennen" • "Pozdrav svijetu" • "Due grosse lacrime bianche" • "Desfolhada portuguesa" • "Oj, oj, oj, så glad jeg skal bli"

Performers Salomé • Lulu • Lenny Kuhr • Frida Boccara • Paola del Medico • Jean Jacques • Muriel Day • Louis Neefs • Tommy Körberg • Siw Malmkvist • Romuald • Jarkko & Laura • Ivan & 3M • Iva Zanicchi • Simone de Oliveira • Kirsti Sparboe
